pros: Hires ASN (stopped for about a year and put a BSN requirement into effect)
cons: ALWAYS short staffed on nurses and aides. Pay is extremely low. Heavy workloads and high patient acuity. High turnover rate. Little room for advancement. Even if you get a degree through the ONE school they pay for there is no financial incentive in your current job and limited new positions (even for nurses). No bonuses (1 or 2% annually does not even reflect inflation appropriately). Lack of support from managers. All staff are replacement to Penn. Magnet status DOES NOT matter to nurses- fair pay and staffing ratios do! The hospital made "Penn is ANTI RACIST" pins and handed them out to employees...if you have to make a pin to communicate that there is a problem and pins are not the way to fix it.

pros: Good pay, benefits. Great experience. Supportive
cons: Stressful, fast paced. Short staffing. High demand.

review_title: amazing, It has honestly changed my life.
pros: Everyone from every position is treated with respect.My direct supervisor & manager constantly teach me better ways to respect every individual who walks into our building, it has made me a better person.I feel important and know my job matters. The company does it's best to always acknowledge employees who give their best.Even if you work part time your eligible for benefits And benefits are good,the pay is good and all raises are strictly by job performance.You  accumulate both vacation time & sick time by how many hours you work - which I love.They also help you with schooling. And the company is great & well respected in the area & nationally.
cons: I can't think of anything worth mentioning. My only con is employees who can't be flexible enough to work well with others. You always get a few bad apples in every basket. I hear the same about managers. I feel lucky & honored to have the managers I do.

pros: I enjoyed working with the patients. My goal was to make their day just a little better.
cons: hostile work environment, dishonest co-workers, management and HR

review_title: Great for experience but not a career
pros: The experience of working in a hospital. The wonderful patients I had and my fellow employees.
cons: The only thing that LGH seems to care about is survey results and numbers. For what they pay they do not offer much to you as an employee. What they pay you as a nurse with a BSN is what some LPNS at a doctors office or CNAs at a nursing home get paid. The environment was stressful. They are constantly short staffed which made nursing very unsafe. I spent at least 4-8 hours a pay period doing things that weren’t directly related to patient care just to keep up with all their requirements. They do not pay the Ptca well at all for all the hard work they do.

review_title: A slowly sinking Ship.  Even small leaks will sink big ships. Negative atmosphere building.
job_title: Non-Clinical Support Staff in Lancaster, PA
pros: Ok if you can find a small hole to hide in and a good manager.  Most managers don't have the best people skills.   In passing a manager I  once asked about a project only to be verbaly accused of not minding my own business, followed by a note to my mgr.   A simple "no  comment" would have sufficed.   Check you brain in at the door.
cons: Not fiscally sound spending.  Just purchased $6m BB&T bldg for $9m. The large surplus profits don't trickle down below LPN's.  I constantly hear from friends of better health ins coverage at lower cost from other companies.    Too often employees hear LGH news by the newspaper before upper management acknowledges.

pros: Flexible scheduling for some units
cons:
After fighting LGH and Quest for 3 months now regarding payment of counseling benefits I used while employed, I've decided  to speak up. The Employee Assistance Program is one of the many benefits they claim to provide (free, it's right on their website), and yet I am still being billed for various phony copays- with LGH yesterday threatening to send my bill to a collection agency. I finally paid it because I have called LGH and Quest Behavioral Health numerous times, and have gotten nowhere.

This is my second terrible experience with LGH benefits, after needing to schedule a court hearing just to get reimbursed for $150 in medical bills I accrued from a work injury last year.  They only finally paid me because as the lady explained to me, "It will be cheaper than fighting you in court".

Way to support your employees LGH.

job_title: PC Tech II in Lancaster, PA
pros:
PC Equipment modern
Ordering new equipment/licenses not a problem
Some skilled people
If you actually get hired pay/benefits aren't that bad, however see cons about getting hired
Not a bad place for someone to start in IT
cons:
Low Pay and no benefits with temps so they end up with a lot of goofballs who can't get a job anywhere else
High turnover among temps
Management plays bait and switch games saying permanent jobs are opening only to have them be frozen until next year
Good Temps that have been there a while get supervisor/senior tech responsibility with no increase in pay.
You do the same, sometimes even better job that LGH IT staff who are making 3x in compensation what you are.

review_title: Friendly, great benefits and perks, but subpar management
pros: Overall, employees are treated well and given decent pay and benefits. The atmosphere and area are friendly and a great place to raise a family.
cons:
Senior management uses scare tactics to strongarm all its competition; LG controls nearly all healthcare facilities and offices in Lancaster County and is now reaching beyond. Management training is lacking, and there is quite a bit of favoritism of some employees over others.

There has been a lot of unrest lately because electronic health records are making many medical records positions unnecessary; but management refuses to discuss what their long-range plan is.

The management style and low pay, as well as the lack of communication to employees about job changes, are difficult on employees.

review_title: NO PAY RAISE!!!!!!! - mgt didn't save for a rainy day
job_title: Multi Skilled Technician in Lancaster, PA
pros: No layoffs during pandemic - although I would have thourghly enjoyed 26 weeks of unemployment + $600 fed subsidy even if I would have been netting a little less after paying for med ins premiums. I saved for a rainy day unlike some.
cons: Mgt much rather dump money into a dubious PROTON THERAPY machine that has extremely limited value. I thought the cyber knife therapy project was bad ( Used very little) this 100 mill project eclipse that boondoggle. At lest they got rid of the Gamma Knife Therapy Machine (used rarely) recently to install a way more useful Radiation therapy machine that will get used regularly.

review_title: IT department is terrible here and has been for years
pros: You can coast for years here
cons:
No career progression in IT department
No empowerment or delegation, even first line managers have no voice.
There has been so much turn over in staff and management because of nepotism at the top. 
If you are not a doctor or a nurse you are viewed as an expense to minimize and treated like a 3rd class citizen.  
If you show any aptitude you will be over worked while teammates can feign task incompetence.

pros: Benefits are ok (not great)
cons: They provide the illusion that it's a good place to work, but withhold how downright false that is being that people are constantly overworked. Not only that, but they write you up even when you become overworked claiming you aren't meeting expectations. Good luck keeping people there! HR is worthless, careless, and lazy. Human Resources seems like a fake industry with people who intervene where necessary, but really do not attempt to mediate anything.

pros: Good job stability and adequate benefits.
cons: Career advancement can be difficult, as getting past the HR department can be nearly impossible. In addition, health care reform has caused the organization to enact severe cost-reduction measures which has been passed along to the employees in the form on decreasing benefits, etc.

job_title: Intensive Care Unit Registered Nurse in Royston, East of England, England
pros: Well connected, excellent nursing shared governance, Magnet hospital, Top 100 hospital in 7 specialties, HIMSS 7, professional practice is tops, great positions in a variety of settings, multiple inpatient sites-downtown has Lancaster General Hospital, Downtown Outpatient Pavilion, the Suburban Outpatient Pavilion (Health Campus), Women and Babies Hospital, Ann B. Barshinger Cancer Institute. Many opportunities for a diverse amount of inpatient/outpatient jobs.
cons: Pay is sub-par, limited primarily by lack of geographically close competition. Completely unwilling to consider any kind of union representation. Little opportunity for executive advancement.

review_title: So so place, only Nurses and Doctors get paid great. All other staff underpaid with lots of responsibilities.
job_title: Anesthesia Technician in Royston, East of England, England
pros: Benefits, personal time off, bonus once a year
cons: Pay sucks.  Other hospitals pay way more and with less responsibilities (An AT at LGH makes $15 an hour when at Penn State Hershey same position gets paid $20 an hour with lot less responsibilities).  Training is horrible, most of the time left alone, learn as you go.   OR (Operating Room) environment is toxic, lots of bad attitude.

pros:
Great benefits (time off, health, dental, vision, employee discounts, and more). 
Flexible hours when needed. Managers work with you on your needs to balance your at home and work life. 
Team members are very kind and help whenever they can.
Culture is wonderful and inviting.
Training is offered and taken seriously.
Compensation is fair, regardless of always wanting "more" 
Tuition Assistance benefits are awesome.. I was not planning to go back to school but here I am enrolled in a Master's program.
Transfer opportunities available
cons:
create more at-home work opportunities.
holidays are taken from your time off which is weird to me.

pros: Working with people who want to improve their lives and learn skills and tools to live the fullest and happiest life they possibly can
cons: It is impossible to reach as many people as I would like to so have to look at this opportunity as I can  help one person who will go out and share their  new knowledge and skills with others around them.

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Lancaster, PA
pros: Great location; great mission.  Employees are friendly and welcoming.
cons: Often they hired into management positions from outside the company rather than promoting from within. They did not provide challenging opportunities, or include employees in decision making.  Lots and lots of politics.

review_title: Do NOT work in the basement
job_title: Storeroom in Royston, East of England, England
pros: PTB, 8 hour shifts,
cons: mandatory weekend, EXTREMELY understaffed, rude supervisors, sexist leads, overworked, underpaid, very unappreciated by "higher ups" , nurses are rude because you are under them

pros: Teamwork within the unit; diversity; free parking
cons: Management cares only about the bottom line.  An extremely profitable hospital, LGH's money goes deep into the pockets of management.  Those of us on the front lines can barely get a raise each year -- despite our strong work ethic and the success of our unit.  Requests from management for employee input consistently fall on deaf ears.  Employees are fed up, and it shows.

review_title: USC great way to experience the medcal field
pros: Consistent schedule, good benefits, reliable employer, safe atmosphere. Get to see what goes on in the medical field from all points of view without doing direct patient care, which is nice because you can have the option to decide if you want to go to a different position down the road. Get to see it all.
cons: Sitting a lot, lots of desk work.

pros: Excellent benefits and structure to the heath system. Focus on patient care and employee engagement.
cons: Difficult to advance into other positions (a lot of talking among managers and directors/cliques, even in senior leadership). Also, roles that are easily remote were always denied.

pros: Wages are at the high end of the usual range for a given job, great medical and pension benefits, clean and well-kept facilities and lots of extra perks like discount pharmacy, on-site dry cleaning and convenience store, discounted movie and event tickets, etc.
cons: It's a big place and with the pressures on the cost of health care, the pace can be pretty fast.

pros: There were excellent health/dental/vision benefits, along with ample opportunities to build up personal time off. In my personal experience, my manager was very flexible and understanding when personal/family emergencies arose.
cons: The staff are not always very good at adjusting to change, and following through with goals is not always a priority. There was also blatant judgemental behavior from individuals in 'higher' positions to those that were not as 'educated' as they were.

review_title: shark tank, most people pursuing personal agendas, despite that some VERY smart people
pros: Perceived stability  high performance standards
cons: Clear goals not communicated, no consistency in managers, national "leader" in new ideas- sometimes didn't work out,

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Lancaster, PA

review_title: Lancaster General Hospital - Forward Thinking, a Great Place to Work!

cons: If looking for maximum clinical opportunities, LGH doesn’t have a surgical NICU or transplant program. And has only 2 physician residencies: Family Health and Trauma

pros: Great company to work for with great benefits and perks. Many opportunities to expand your nursing knowledge and role as well as be a part of the Lancaster community.
cons: Unsure of the future of the company after the UPenn merger and what that may mean for the nurses employed there.

pros: I got to get alot of experience working for different companies doing different jobs.
cons: The only bad thing i can say is that its hard to continuously temp. I will only do temp to hire right now.

job_title: Laundry and Linens in Lancaster, PA
pros: Benefits are good along with employee perks.
cons: I currently work in laundry and linens. Management is horrible. You question how the people they hire in this department got a job, considering you jump through hoops to get in. Drama, drama, drama among employees. NO recognition for a job well done! You can not transfer out of a department for 15 months!

pros: Great management in lab area, especially Phlebotomy.  Great learning hospital.
cons: They need to pay their phlebotomists better, especially the seasoned ones.  People applying and starting out should not be offered close to what people that have been there almost 10 years are making.

pros: The organization has good core values with average employee benefits and incentives.  The organization is attentive to technological advancements and modernization of their facilities.
cons: Salaries are not competitive in comparison to national averages.  The Mentoring philosophy is weak with marginal attention to Succession Planning.

job_title: Patient Care Host in Lancaster, PA
pros: Benefits are good; health, dental & vision taken out every paycheck. Other perks working for the hospital like discounts to stores/services/products.
cons: Just feeling like a number to the organization

pros: Good benefits. - Heath dental vision.  - tuition plan - wellness center - supportive of continuing education. - quick response - helpful. - nice staff.
